MenuEntries.name: Navigation
MenuEntries.description: Use cases related to the navigation in SEE

MenuEntries.name: Player navigation
MenuEntries.description: How to navigate in SEE

HelpEntries.text: Press Key W or S to move forwards or backwards.
You can move to the right or left with Key A or D.
To change your view direction keep the right mouse button pressed while moving your mouse.
With Key E and Q you can go up and down.

MenuEntries.name: City navigation
MenuEntries.description: How to navigate a code city

MenuEntries.name: Zoom into Code Cities
MenuEntries.description: How to zoom into a code city

HelpEntries.text: Hover with the mouse over the city you want to zoom into.
Now, you can scroll the mouse wheel up and down for zooming in and out.
The zooming is focussed on the mouse pointer.

MenuEntries.name: Architecture
MenuEntries.description: Use cases related to the architecture

MenuEntries.name: Player Menu
MenuEntries.description: Player Menu use cases

MenuEntries.name: Move node
MenuEntries.description: How to move a node

HelpEntries.text: Initially the move mode is selected. If not press Space and left click on Move.
Press and hold the left mouse button to drag a node.
Release mouse button to place the node on its new position.
You can undo by pressing Control and Z.

MenuEntries.name: Rotate node
MenuEntries.description: How to rotate a node

HelpEntries.text: Press Space for opening the player menu.
Left click on the entry Rotate Node.
Left click on the node. A yellow ring appears.
Left click and hold the ring. Move your mouse and release when you reach the right rotation.

MenuEntries.name: Hide Node
MenuEntries.description: How to hide node(s)

HelpEntries.text: Work in Progress.

MenuEntries.name: Add Edge
MenuEntries.description: How to add a new edge

HelpEntries.text: Press Space for opening the player menu.
Left click on the entry new edge.
Left click on a node to select the start node.
Left click on a node to select the target node.
You can now see the edge as a spline with a color gradient.
Press key U to reset the selected start node.

MenuEntries.name: Add Node
MenuEntries.description: How to add a new node

HelpEntries.text: Press Space for opening the player menu.
Left click on the entry New Node.
Search for the place you want to insert the node.
Left click to place it.
Open player menu again to choose Edit Node.
Left click on your new node and add attributes to it.

MenuEntries.name: Edit Node
MenuEntries.description: How to edit an existing node

HelpEntries.text: Press Space for opening the player menu.
Left click on the entry edit node.
Left click on the node you want to edit.
You can see all editable metrics inside of this new window.
Insert new values, if so desired.
Finish the editing process by pushing the Okay button.

MenuEntries.name: Scale Node
MenuEntries.description: How to scale a node

HelpEntries.text: Press Space for opening the player menu.
Left click on the entry scale node.
Left click on a node. Axis will appear.
Drag the axis in which direction you want to scale the node.
Release mouse to confirm..

MenuEntries.name: Delete Node or Edge
MenuEntries.description: How to delete node or edge

HelpEntries.text: Press Space for opening the player menu.
Left click on entry Delete
To delete an edge just left click it.
After blinking it will disappear.
You can also remove a node with its edges, just click it.
After blinking it will also disappear.
You can undo with Control and Z.

MenuEntries.name: Show Code
MenuEntries.description: How to show code of a node.

HelpEntries.text: This Code city represents the SEE project.
To see code, open the player menu with space.
Left click on the entry Show Code.
Left click to select a node. A code window opens.
You can also use the context menu. Right click on a node.
Now choose Show Code again.
By dragging the code window corner you can adjust the size.

MenuEntries.name: Search for a node
MenuEntries.description: How to search for a node by source-name

HelpEntries.text: Work in Progress.

MenuEntries.name: Evolution
MenuEntries.description: Use cases related to software-evolution

MenuEntries.name: Navigation bar
MenuEntries.description: How to navigate between versions of evolution

HelpEntries.text: You can start the evolution with the play button at the navigation bar.
You can see the current version of all versions on the lower right side.
If you want to pause the evolution, press the pause button, which appears after pushing the play button.
The other play button is for backward playing and works as same as the normal play button.
Pushing multiple times on the double play buttons determines the play speed.
New classes falling from the top.
Deleted classes disappears to the top.
Red nodes with edges are clones in this City.
You also can skip by moving the dragger of the navigation bar by left click on it.

MenuEntries.name: Drawable
MenuEntries.description: Use cases related to drawable-system

MenuEntries.name: Draw free in the room
MenuEntries.description: How to draw somewhere in the room

HelpEntries.text: Press Space for opening the player menu.
Left click on the entry Draw.
Left click and hold to draw.
Your drawing is now placed in the room and you can walk around it.

MenuEntries.name: Draw free on the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to draw free on the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Press Space for opening the player menu.
Left click on the entry drawable.
Now choose Draw Freehand.
You can also open the drawable bar by clicking the up arrow in the middle of the screen.
Left click on the first icon, its the brush.
On the right you can adjust thickness, line kind and color.
To draw just click and hold the left mouse button

MenuEntries.name: Draw shape on the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to draw a shape on the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click on the second left icon.
To simply draw a straight line, just click where you want to start.
Then move your mouse and click for a second point.
You can go on or click finshed on the right side.
You can also choose a different shape by clicking the left and right arrows.
For a rectangle adjust the values for a and b.
To place the shape click on the desired places on the whiteboard

MenuEntries.name: Add text to the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to add text to the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click on the third left icon with a big A.
On the right you can adjust your desired text formatting.
Left click on the whiteboard to select a place for your text.
Insert your text in the up comming Input field.

MenuEntries.name: Add image to the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to add a image on the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click on the fourth left icon with a image.
Left click on the whiteboard where you want to add an image.
The place of your image can be local on your machine or in the web.
If you press local, you can search your image in a file browser.
Allowed image formats are png, jpg and jpeg.
Press save and your image is placed.

MenuEntries.name: Create a mindmap on the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to create a mindmap on the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click on the fifth left icon.
Start with left click on central theme
Then left click on the whiteboard where you want to place the theme.
Put your text in the up comming input field.
Now place a Subtheme as you did before with the central theme.
You need to select the parent after it.
Placing a leaf works the same.
You can also add another sub theme to an existing one.

MenuEntries.name: Create a sticky note
MenuEntries.description: How to create a sticky note

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click the icon that looks just like a sticky note.
Start with a left click on spawn.
Then select a place on the whiteboard where you want to place the sticky note.
With move you can place it even on other places.
You can choose Laying so it looks like its laying on the table.
Clicking on next, brings you to the rotation option.
Use the slider or the shown values to rotate.
To edit it click edit followed by selecting the sticky note.
With the color picker you can change the color.
With scale you can adjust the size.

MenuEntries.name: Use the color picker of the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to use the color picker of the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click on the pipette.
Left click on the place where you want to get the color of.
The color is now collected and you can go on with drawing with the brush.

MenuEntries.name: Move or rotate objects on the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to move or rotate objects on the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click on the crossed arrows.
Click on the object you want to move or rotate.
Click move and then use the arrows to move the object.
Toggeling Move by mouse sticks your object to your mouse.
Left click where you want to place it.
To rotate just click this instead and use the slider.

MenuEntries.name: Scale objects on the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to scale objects on the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click the diagonal arrows.
Left click on the object you want to scale.
You can now change the values for x and y.

MenuEntries.name: Change sorting layer of objects on the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to change the sorting layer of objects on the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click on the icon with 3 layers.
With a left click you can increase the layer order. With a right click you can decrease the layer order.
There a minimum and maximum layer order which will be shown if you want to go further.

MenuEntries.name: Cut, copy and paste objects on the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to cut, copy and paste objects on the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click the icon with the two pages and the scissors.
Click on the object you want to cut or copy.
To cut, click cut on the right. Choose a new place afterwards by clicking on the whiteboard.
Copy works the same.

MenuEntries.name: Move a point on the whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to move a point on the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click the icon with the hand.
Click on a point on the whiteboard, it will stick to your mouse.
Click again to place the point to its new position.

MenuEntries.name: Save content of whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to save content of the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click on the save icon.
Click on the whiteboard you want to save.
Click save and choose your save position in the file browser.
Click save again to save in the selected folder.

MenuEntries.name: Clear content of whiteboard
MenuEntries.description: How to clear content of the whiteboard

HelpEntries.text: Use the drawable bar and click on the eraser icon.
Choose between current page and all pages.
Then toggle to Delete Page and click on the whiteboard.

MenuEntries.name: Debugging
MenuEntries.description: Use cases related to software-debugging

MenuEntries.name: Quality
MenuEntries.description: Use cases related to the software-quality

MenuEntries.name: Show Metrics
MenuEntries.description: How to show metrics of a node

HelpEntries.text: Hover over a node in the code city.
Right click on the node and then click show metric.
You can now see all metrics this node has and even search for them.

MenuEntries.name: Code Cities
MenuEntries.description: Use cases related to Code

MenuEntries.name: Add a code city by config file
MenuEntries.description: How to add a code city by config file

HelpEntries.text: Press K to open the config menue.
Add a config file to ConfigurationPath
Click Load configuration.
Click load data and then draw data.
Your Code city will appear.

MenuEntries.name: Collaboration
MenuEntries.description: Use cases related to Collaboration/Multiplayer

MenuEntries.name: Connect as Client
MenuEntries.description: How to connect as a client

HelpEntries.text: In the main menue select the settings.
Add the provided IP address and server port
Sometimes you also get a password for log in.
You can also change your name which is displayed to others.
At the bottom you can choose the chat version
Now you only need to press OK and select Client to connect.

MenuEntries.name: Text chat
MenuEntries.description: How to chat with others

HelpEntries.text: Press F2 to open the text chat.
You can now write a message and send it with Enter.
Other people in the room will get your message displayed next to your name.

MenuEntries.name: Miscellaneous
MenuEntries.description: Use cases related to Miscellaneous

MenuEntries.name: Use Mirror
MenuEntries.description: How to connect use the mirror

HelpEntries.text: Press F8 to toggle the Mirror.
The mirror will be shown or paused.
You can use it to check your character and name.

MenuEntries.name: Use Browser
MenuEntries.description: How to use the browser

HelpEntries.text: Press F4 to open the browser.
By default you see the website of SEE.
Use the bottom input field to type in the url.

MenuEntries.name: Use VR headset
MenuEntries.description: How to use a VR headset

HelpEntries.text: In the main menue press Toggle Desktop/VR.
The selected mdoe will be displayed in the right upper corner.
